content: Continuing discussion from #10754; pinging @Rishi Gupta
What's the problem you see with colored names being used to represent guest users?
Mainly, that color interacts with the visual design in a lot of ways, and is tough for accessibility.

Also, about the triangle icon being used to represent users; I assume you're proposing to add them to the right of names? We don't display bot icons in the typeahead, so I thinking adding the icon to the typeahead isn't consistent with the design in general.
right, we would find a place that could be used to display either the bot icon, guest icon, possibly admin icon in the future, etc

Hm, I believe we'd be able to add some kind of aria label indicating that the user is a guest through a span element that would also color the text? Maybe a bright green or something, I'm open to color suggestions. The main benefit is that it'd be faster to implement.
We don't want the guest thing to be super prominent

The triangle icon still sounds nice, but I think it'd be better if there was a more verbose way of indicating that a guest is a user through an icon; guest definitely isn't the first thing I think about when I see a triangle next to a user's name
yeah, definitely open to better ideas for the icon
Maybe a circle with a question mark? Or the handshake icon
There's also the share/forward icon and hand peace sign and eye icon
I think an icon is going to be less nice than just marking their avatars in the typeahead the same way we're doing in the message feed.
In part because we need to teach what the icon means

To me, the corner decoration on the avatar is basically an icon on the avatar; coming in as a new user I'd have no idea what that colored corner is supposed to signify. Are there any other alternatives other than icon next to the name, colored name, and avatar corner decorations?
